Class ModificationController

java.lang.Object
projatlab.controller.ModificationController
public class ModificationController extends Object
ModificationController handles user interactions for modifying the maze like changing walls, the start and the end It manages a copy of the original maze, applies changes via user clicks, and saves the modifications back into the original maze

    Class

    Enum representing the modification modes.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    handleClick(double x, double y)
    Handles a user click on the maze, determining the action based on the current mode (modifying walls, start, or end).
    void
    handleSave()
    Saves all modifications to the original maze Copies wall, then the start and end, then the visual states (visited or not, is in final path..), updates everything in the original maze and then closes
    void
    setMode(ModificationController.Mode mode)
    Sets the current modification mode

  • Constructor Details

    • ModificationController

      public ModificationController(Maze maze, MazeView view, Maze originalMaze, javafx.stage.Stage modStage)
      Constructor for ModificationController
      Parameters:
      maze - The temporary maze where modifications are applied
      view - The visual representation of the maze to reflect changes
      originalMaze - The original maze where changes will be saved
      modStage - Window to make modifications closed upon save

  • Method Details

    • setMode

      public void setMode(ModificationController.Mode mode)
      Sets the current modification mode
      Parameters:
      mode - the mode to be used

    • handleClick

      public void handleClick(double x, double y)
      Handles a user click on the maze, determining the action based on the current mode (modifying walls, start, or end).
      Parameters:
      x - the X-coordinate of the mouse click
      y - the Y-coordinate of the mouse click

    • handleSave

      public void handleSave()
      Saves all modifications to the original maze Copies wall, then the start and end, then the visual states (visited or not, is in final path..), updates everything in the original maze and then closes
